title: Lesson 74
paragraph: This lesson focuses on desire and temptation, including yearning, indulgent, and fervent behaviors.

words.example: He felt a yearning for his childhood home.

words.meaning: having a strong desire for something that belongs to someone else
words.example: She was covetous of her neighbor’s success.

words.meaning: having a tendency to be overly generous or lenient
words.example: The teacher was indulgent with the students.
He is passionate about environmental issues.

words.meaning: having a huge appetite; eager to consume
words.example: She has a voracious appetite for reading.

words.japaneseMeaning: 満たされない、飽くことのない
words.example: His insatiable curiosity drove him to explore more.
The character in the story was lustful and reckless.
She is a fervent supporter of human rights.

words.japaneseMeaning: 夢中になって、魅了されて
words.example: He was enamored of the city’s beauty.

words.japaneseMeaning: 欲している、望んでいる
words.example: She was desirous of a peaceful life.
